Custom widgets
This module is currently under development and has limited functionality.
In the On-Premise solution, access to the module is possible after adding
parameters to the application’s configuration file
.
Depending on the needs of the product being developed, standard tools may not be sufficient during the
visual setup
.
The System provides functionality that allows users to create their own
widgets
with individual settings and define their final appearance.
Creating custom widgets requires basic knowledge of HTML markup.
Creating custom widgets is available to users with the
"View metadata"
and
"Edit metadata"
permissions.
To navigate to the widget development environment, select the following main menu items: Administration → Settings → Widget development environment.
The main elements of the widget development environment interface are:
Setting
Purpose
"Widgets" Block
Contains custom and system widgets, organized into folders.
"Widget components" Block
Contains templates of ready-to-use widget components.
Settings area
Used for code creation.
Preview area
Designed for previewing the final display of the widget and its settings.
For compact display and ease of use, the size of the elements in the development environment can be adjusted by moving the dividing lines between them left/right, and blocks or areas can be completely hidden by clicking
or
buttons between them.
"Widgets" Block
This block contains custom and system widgets located in folders of the same name.
Viewing and hiding folder contents is managed by clicking the
and
buttons next to the folder name.
System widgets
Creating and editing widgets in the "System" folder is not available.
Widgets located in the "System" folder can be used as ready-made templates when creating custom widgets. The current set includes the following widgets:
"Text"
,
"Button"
, and
"Navigation panel"
. Given the active development of the System, the list of available widgets will be regularly updated, allowing users to extend functionality and customize the interface according to their needs.
Hovering over the name of a widget will reveal the
button, which, when clicked, will copy the widget to the "Custom" folder, where its contents will be available for editing.
Custom widgets
The "Custom" folder contains all widgets created by user. Hovering over the folder will display the following buttons:
– creating a new folder inside the current one;
- creating a new widget inside the current folder.
Clicking the
button will create a new widget containing the
Settings.html
and
View.html
files (the process of working with these files is described
further below
):
By default, the widget is named "Custom widget" and has the
icon. The widget can be renamed by double-clicking its current name, and its icon can be changed by clicking it and selecting a new one from the list of available icons.
Hovering over the widget name will display buttons for copying
and deleting
the widget.
If a widget is used in the System, deleting it will open a modal window listing all
instance visuals
where it was placed for deletion confirmation.
Widgets can be moved between folders using Drag&Drop via the
element to the left of the widget name.
To quickly locate a required widget, the search by name bar can be used.
"Widget components" Block
This block contains templates of widget components.
Templates can be added by dragging and dropping (Drag&Drop) a component from the "Widget components" block into a file opened in the
Settings area
.
As a result, the selected component’s code template will be added to the file, and its final display will be available in the preview area:
Settings
Creating a custom widget involves using two files:
Settings.html
template:
This file is used to define widget settings displayed in a modal window when clicking the
button while placing the widget on a visual;
View.html
template:
This file defines the final display of the widget based on the settings selected by user.
When changes are made to the file, an indicator will appear to the left of its name, and the
control panel
will display a
button. Clicking it will save all changes and remove the indicator.
